revised_title: Investigating Water Evaporation and Its Effects
tldr: Edm. Halley conducted experiments to study the evaporation of water in Gresham College. He found that the sun and wind play a significant role in evaporation, and the depth of water evaporated in a year is much less than the findings of other researchers. Halley also discovered that the vapors of water adhere to the surface that exhaled them, causing refraction and strange appearances. This phenomenon may explain why objects seem raised or disappear at certain times.
scientific_discipline: Environmental and Earth Sciences > Atmospheric Science
